chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Andre White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.42.
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (22 pages) commencing 11-16-2015 received and filed.
Count two.
Count one.

Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State and defense counsel.

As to Count 1:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 10 MONTHS  in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Case# 15CM00383 with credit for  232  days served; Court will allow good time credit to be earned.  

As to Count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  18  months, consecutive -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  12  months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  6  months. 
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

As to both counts:
- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
- No fine
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges no later than 11-16-2018.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.  
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Michael Andre White in court with Attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Defendant Michael Andre White in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
 
As to Count 1 and Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders the "repeater" enhancer [939.62(1)(b)] dismissed.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of NO CONTEST to the counts and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of the amended charges and enters a judgment of conviction.

As to Counts 3, 4, 5, and 6:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Counts 3, 4, 5, and 6  DISMISSED, but read-in as to sentencing.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Jury trial is vacated.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Michael Andre White not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case remains in trial posture for 11-16-2015.
NOTE: File had been retained in courtroom for submission of ORDER from defense as to release for medical issues.  Order has not been submitted.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Michael Andre White not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to modify bail due to defendant's health condition argued.  The state is opposed to a straight PR BOND TOT Justice point as the defendant does not have a stable residence.
The court will allow the defendant to be released under Justicepoint supervision for medical appointments and procedures upon submission of verified appointments and medical care and then bail to revert back to cash.  Defense counsel will draft an order for the court's signature with all the necessary information.
FILE RETAINED IN COURTROOM
Motion for Bail Reduction received and filed.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Michael Andre White not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requested final pretrial and jury trial dates. Defense to file a motion to reduce bail and requested a bail/bond hearing be scheduled as well. Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Request for payment of $17  witness fees for witness Vicki L. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26211719 in court 1x on 8/3/15.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Michael Andre White not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is currently hospitalized and defense counsel needs to obtain further information.  Court will set a status/scheduling date of 9-9-2015.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Michael Andre White not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Status Conference. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Witness fee request prepared for VICKI L., will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.
Order signed and filed.

Defendant Michael Andre White in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Michael Andre White in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Thomey is moving to withdraw as counsel as communication has broken down with the defendant.  Defendant is also requesting new counsel.  The court will grant the motion to withdraw and refer defendant back to SPD for counsel.  The court finds CAUSE to waive the speedy trial demand and informs defendant that he may re-assert STD at next court appearance.
Upon request of the state the court will RESCIND the defendant's telephone, vistations and US mail custody privileges.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Michael Andre White in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Michael Andre White in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant rejected the offer of the State.  Offer is now withdrawn, per the State.  On 3-30-2015, the Court found good cause to adjourn the speedy jury trial on case (2015CM383), based on the new case (2015CFG1358).  The Court ordered that the cash bond on case 2015CM383 is now converted to a signature bond in the amount of $250.00.  Court maintains the current cash bond of $2,500.00 on case 2015CF1358.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel on cases; 2015CF1358 and 2015CM383.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 8-3-2015 at 8:30 am.  The date of 8-3-2015, was the only date for trial that worked for both parties within the limits of the speedy trial.   mld

Defendant Michael Andre White in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Michael Andre White in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee County DA Investigator Carl Buschmann.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument heard and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Court took judicial notice of the certified documents attached to the criminal complaint.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Discovery was previously turned over to defense counsel, per the State.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-5-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Michael Andre White in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Michael Andre White in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: Cases 2015CM383 and 2015CF1358.  Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-6-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with VICKI L.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Andre White in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Michael Andre White in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  The Court orders this matter set for scheduling conference before Branch 04 on tomorrow due to defendant's pending case (15CM383) set for jury trial on 3-30-15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
